Types

AsyncIoBase = ref object of RootRef
Base type for all AsyncIo objects Define all methods and handle locks Source   Edit  

Procs

proc cancelAll(self: AsyncIoBase) {....raises: [Exception, ValueError, OSError],
                                    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Kick out all pending readers and writers

The consequence for readers and writers are the same as if they would have used read(..., cancelFut) or write(..., cancelFut)

Source   Edit   
proc clear(self: AsyncIoBase; cancelFut = sleepAsync(5)): owned(Future[void]) {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Execute cancelAll, then read all available data By default, use a minimal timer to know when data is fully read Source   Edit   
proc closed(self: AsyncIoBase): bool {.used, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
proc read(self: AsyncIoBase; count: Natural; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    string] {....stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError],
              tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Await the data read len is count

If cancelled was triggered, no attempt to read data is made and an empty string is returned. If cancelled is triggered during read, all available read data is returned (can be an empty string)

Source   Edit   
proc readAll(self: AsyncIoBase; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[string] {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
proc readAvailable(self: AsyncIoBase; count: Natural;
                   cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[string] {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect],
    forbids: [].}

Await at least one byte is available. So read can be from 1 byte to count

If cancelled is triggered during read, an empty string is returned

Source   Edit   
proc readChunk(self: AsyncIoBase; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[string] {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect],
    forbids: [].}

Await at least one byte is available. Try to read a big chunk of data to optimize speed

The exact size is implementation specific and can vary between objects

Source   Edit   
proc readLine(self: AsyncIoBase; keepNewLine = false;
              cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[string] {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect],
    forbids: [].}

Attempt to read up to a newline or to the end of stream

newline can be kept if keepNewLine is set to true, which can be used to distinguish when end of stream is reached

Source   Edit   
proc transfer(src, dest: AsyncIoBase; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil;
              flushAndCloseAfter = false): Future[void] {....stackTrace: false,
    raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect], forbids: [].}
Transfer read from src immediatly to dest using readChunk Returns a future when completed If flushAndCloseAfter is set to true, src will be cleared then closed when transfer is over Source   Edit   
proc write(self: AsyncIoBase; data: string; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    int] {....stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError],
           tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Await write is available and write to it

Number of bytes written is returned and can be inferior to data.len()

Source   Edit   
proc writeDiscard(self: AsyncIoBase; data: string; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    void] {....raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Await write is available and write to it

Number of bytes can be inferior to data.len()
